reviews.review_msg: Shayna is such an unique amazing human being. I have never learnt so much and had so much fun while doing so. Her class is eye opening, she shows you a different way to look at issues that are key to social justice. Shayna knows how to develop your potential to be an A student if you let her. I wish she was professor to every SFU course.
Keen, interesting, and passionate. Great class.

The assignments seem quite daunting initially, but as long as you do the readings and go to class then you will do just fine.  I gained an enormous amount of knowledge from this class and would definitly recommend it for those who are willing to work hard.  He is approachable, kind and makes himself available for students.  Great class!

The class was slightly overwhelming but I gained so much knowledge.  I am quite sure my IQ has gone up a few points.  Not a class for slackers or non-academics.  Tamir is a relatively new instructor, so I sense a bit of nervousness in him but I'm sure he will get better as time goes on.
Are you crazy?  This was one of the best courses that I have taken at SFU.  It was also one of the most demanding....but it's worth the effort.
If you hate yourself, take the course.

He is a fantastic professor! Always available to help students out, and super dedicated to his job. You get the grade you worked for; so if you want an A, you need to do the readings and come prepared. Very fair marker. Over all, one of my favorite profs at SFU.
